page.title: 11ATTITUDES IN BRAMSHAW AREA
page.content: 1. One common sentiment is a cynical suspicion of outside interference. This applies to diverse groups, such as pro-animal rights factions, who wish to stop hunting or limit the right of commoners to run stock on the Forest; or big business, anxious to explore for oil or build profitable houses; or central planners wishing to build faster roads. 2. {WELFARE STATE. }Interestingly, criticism comes from the younger, less affluent commoner. Working long hours in a physically demanding job he is not convinced that his unemployed peers seek work very actively. He suspects that they manipulate social benefits & the black economy to receive as much money with less effort The older & wealthier are not so critical.
